result.execSummary:
Edmund J. Reetz was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Edmund J. Reetz was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edmund J. Reetz

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Review hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:23 AM Defendant does not appear in court. Attorney Jason D Sanders in court by video.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant extraditied. Case dismissed on motion of the State.
Review hearing on June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:16 AM Defendant Edmund J. Reetz in court in person and in custody with attorney Jason D Sanders in person.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to extradition freely and voluntarily; signs waiver in open court. Bond revoked. Review hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Extradition hearing on June 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:30 AM Defendant Edmund J. Reetz in court by video in custody with attorney Jason D Sanders in person.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond set of $3000 with conditions.  Extradition hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.
